content: The **U.S. Embassy Singapore Alumni Mentoring Program** is a bilateral educational initiative established in 2013 by the [Embassy of the United States, Singapore](/wiki/Embassy_of_the_United_States,_Singapore), and the [Institute of Technical Education](/wiki/Institute_of_Technical_Education) (ITE). The program was initiated by [David I. Adelman](/wiki/David_I._Adelman), then-[United States Ambassador to Singapore](/wiki/United_States_Ambassador_to_Singapore). Each year, the program pairs ITE students with mentors who are alumni of U.S. government exchange programs, such as [Fulbright Program](/wiki/Fulbright_Program), [Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative](/wiki/Young_Southeast_Asian_Leaders_Initiative), and the [International Visitor Leadership Program](/wiki/International_Visitor_Leadership_Program). Mentors have included representatives from organizations such as [Nike](/wiki/Nike,_Inc.), [Conrad Centennial Singapore](/wiki/Conrad_Centennial_Singapore), [Boeing](/wiki/Boeing), [Mastercard](/wiki/Mastercard), [Bloomberg](/wiki/Bloomberg_L.P.) and [Google](/wiki/Google), alongside U.S. and Singaporean government officials, diplomats, and members of parliament. The program consists of multiple sessions and includes workshops, career talks, and site visits to multinational companies. Topics covered in discussions include goal setting, resilience, and communication skills. By 2024, the program had completed nine cycles.
title: U.S. Embassy Singapore Alumni Mentoring Program
